translated: . The Chronicle of the Buddha Tisya
“After Siddhattha,🔽the peerless one, the matchless one;
Tisya, the leader of the world,
having illuminated the world with its gods;
the enlightened one arose in the world.
his virtue and concentration were incomparable;
having gone to perfection in all things,
he set rolling the wheel of Dhamma.
That Buddha in the ten-thousand world system
at the first teaching of Dhamma.
The second (time) it was ninety koṭis,
the third (time) it was sixty koṭis;
he released beings from their bonds,
gods and men at that time.
of Tisya, the leader of the world;
of those whose defilements were destroyed, who were stainless,

analyzed: santacittāna tādina  khīṇāsava sata sahassāna  paṭhamaḥ āsi samāgamaḥ

translated: The first assembly was of a hundred thousand🔽those whose defilements were destroyed;
the second assembly was of🔽ninety-hundred thousand.
The third assembly was of eighty-hundred thousand,
Of those with corruptions destroyed, the stainless ones,
With the blossoming of their liberation.
At that time I was a noble youth,
and went forth into the forest life.
the Leader of the World arose;

analyzed: pi iti me upapajjatha  dibbam mandāravam puppha
translated: I was filled with joy.🔽A divine Mandārava flower,
I raised them with both hands,
and placed it on the top of the Victor’s head.
while sitting in the midst of the people:
this one will become a Buddha.’
we will be face to face with him.’
was the name of the king;
Padumā was the name of the mother,
Guhāsela was the name of the treasurer, the elephant,
the three were the best of palaces.🔽Thirty thousand women,
the leader of the three worlds,
the great hero set the wheel rolling,
in the supreme city of Yasavatī.
Samaṅga was the name of the attendant,

analyzed: phussā ca iva su dattā ca

translated: The Bodhi tree of that Fortunate One,
is said to have been the Asana.
That Buddha had sixty chief disciples,
was the Victorious One, the High One.
The life of that one of incomparable splendour
the one with vision remained in the world.
Having experienced the highest, the best, the most excellent,
like a mass of fire that has blazed,
he was extinguished together with his disciples.
Like a cloud by the wind,
like a festival by the sun,
he was extinguished together with his disciples.
The Victorious One, the Buddha Tissa,
There, his memorial, the Victor’s monument,
rose up three leagues.”🔽The seventeenth chapter in the glorious Jina’s lineage.
